business.headline: Air India may buy 10 Boeing planes turned down by China: ReportThe ongoing trade tensions between the US and China, marked by steep duties above 100%, have impacted various sectors, even the aviation industry has taken a hit.
Pakistan Stock Exchange portal crashes amid rising geopolitical heatThe online portal of PSX showed a message saying "We'll be back soon," indicating that the website was temporarily unavailable.

Bengaluru resident shares costly homebuying mistake: 'Don't fall for FOMO'A social media user from Bengaluru shared that he has been living in Bengaluru for the past six years. Like many others, he moved to the city for better career opportunities. Despite being financially stable, he chose to rent rather than buy a flat. But the trouble started soon after.

Sensex, Nifty tank: Indo-Pak tensions trigger market crash. Check top losersSensex plunged over 1,000 points, while Nifty tanked over 300 points, falling below 24,000 as uncertainty prevailed over geopolitical tensions.

Apple plans to make all US iPhones in India by 2026: ReportThe said move is part of Apple's long-term plan to reduce its dependence on China, especially after the recent tariff rules announced by US President Donald Trump.

Ather Energy IPO: Check latest GMP as Rs 3,000 crore public listing to open soonThe Ather Energy IPO will be a book-built issue. It consists of a fresh issue of 8.18 crore equity shares worth Rs 2,626 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 1.11 crore shares worth Rs 354.76 crore.

Sensex falls 1,000 points: Why is stock market falling today despite early gains?Sensex and Nifty plunged more than 1% reacting to uncertainty over geopolitical tensions. The S&P BSE Sensex tanked 1,026.28 points to 78,775.15, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 330.40 points to 23,916.30 as of 11:41 am.
Sensex, Nifty erase early gains as markets react to Kashmir terror attackThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 492.29 points to 79,309.14, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 172.15 points to 24,074.55 as of 10 am.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will Dalal Street return to winning ways on April 25?Stock market today: Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,522 as of 7:48 am, which is about 1.1% above Thursday's Nifty50 close of 24,246.7.

Stocks to watch today: RIL, Axis Bank, Gensol, IndusInd Bank, Maruti SuzukiReliance Industries will announce its results for the March 2025 quarter today. The market will be watching closely for updates on its energy, telecom, and retail businesses.

ED raids Gensol promoters, detains Puneet Jaggi from Delhi hotel: ReportSources said the probe agency has invoked provisions under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) following findings of fund diversion and misrepresentation flagged earlier by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi).

Pay10 becomes first entity to go live on CBUAE's open finance frameworkThe new license gives Pay10 secure, real-time access to consumer bank accounts, enabling seamless third-party financial services. This sets the foundation for broader innovations in areas such as embedded finance, digital identity, and interoperable payment systems.

entertainment.headline: Sarkeet trailer: Asif Ali headlines powerful tale of friendship and heartbreakAsif Ali, Divya Prabha and Deepak Parambol have come together for the heartwarming story of 'Sarkeet'. The trailer of the film was released on Thursday.

Mad Square OTT release: When and where to watch Nithin, Ram, Sangeeth's comedy film'MAD Square', the sequel to the hit campus comedy 'MAD', has made its OTT debut, after a successful theatrical run. It hit theatres on March 29.

Actor Kim Soo-hyun's fans hire lawyer to defend him against online harassmentFans of 'Queen of Tears' actor Kim Soo-hyun have appointed a lawyer to tackle the rising online abuse against the actor. The move aims to counter malicious comments and protect his reputation.

Jewel Thief review: Nothing worth stealing in this diamond-sized disasterReleased-Fri Apr 25, 2025Siddharth Anand's 'Jewel Thief: The Heist Begins' puts other mediocre heist dramas like 'Happy New Year' to shame. The Saif Ali Khan and Jaideep Ahlawat-starrer is not even all style, no meat. It's worse than that.

Vikrant Massey to play Sri Sri Ravi Shankar in Siddharth Anand's upcoming thrillerVikrant Massey is set to portray spiritual leader Sri Sri Ravi Shankar in Siddharth Anand's international thriller, 'White,' which delves into Shankar's pivotal role in resolving Colombia's long-standing civil war. The film is being directed by Montoo Bassi.

Tom Cruise's Mission Impossible Final Reckoning to release 6 days early in IndiaThe official Indian release date for Tom Cruise's highly anticipated 'Mission: Impossible - The Final Reckoning' is out. The film will hit Indian theatres six days before its official worldwide release.

Rajinikanth makes a quick stop at temple on his way to Jailer 2 shoot. WatchSupertstar Rajinikanth stopped his vehicle to visit a temple in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore. The actor was on his way to the shooting location of his upcoming film, 'Jailer 2'.

Ground Zero X reviews: Fans call Emraan Hashmi film 'impactful and relevant'Emraan Hashmi's new film 'Ground Zero', has been well-received by audiences. Praised for its strong performances and relevant narrative, the movie addresses contemporary political issues with depth.

Ayyana Mane review: A streak of suspicious deaths, Dhaiva and a dose of mysteryReleased-Fri Apr 25, 2025'Ayyana Mane' is a gripping thriller directed by Ramesh Indira, featuring Khushi Ravi and a talented cast. The miniseries delves into regional folklore, offering a captivating narrative filled with mystery and drama.

Fawad Khan's Abir Gulaal songs removed from YouTube after Pahalgam attackPakistani actor Fawad Khan and Bollywood's Vaani Kapoor star in 'Abir Gulaal'. The move to remove the songs from YouTube comes after the Pahalgam massacre by terrorists, in which 26 people were killed.

Phule review: Pratik-Patralekhaa's revolutionary film dimmed by dull storytellingReleased-Fri Apr 25, 2025'Phule' movie review: Director Ananth Mahadevan's 'Phule' delves into the lives of social reformers Jyotirao Phule and Savitribai Phule and their fight for women's education and caste discrimination. Despite its historical significance, the film struggles to engage the audience.

Aamir Khan was in 'no state' to attend Andaz Apna… re-release amid Pahalgam tragedyA special screening of the 1994 classic 'Andaz Apna Apna' was held earlier this week. However, Aamir Khan opted out of event as he was deeply shaken by the recent terror attack in Pahalgam.

Justin Bieber on divorce rumours with Hailey: Understand why people can't stand itSinger Justin Bieber was in the news after reports of his divorce from wife Hailey Bieber. In a recent Instagram post, he broke his silence on the speculations about his marriage.

Jaat box office Day 15: Sunny's film is Rs 80 crore strong; Rs 100 crore possible?Sunny Deol's 'Jaat' has slowed down at the box office, but has not stepped out of the race. The film has been performing decently so far, but it will face new releases starting this weekend. Will it reach the benchmark of Rs 100 crore?

Kesari 2 box office Day 7: Can Akshay's film grow in 2nd weekend amid new releases?'Kesari Chapter 2' is looking at a weekend full of new releases. This means a bigger challenge for the film to sustain its run, and also to establish decent growth in the second weekend. Will the Akshay Kumar film be able to sail through this?

Ram Charan's Game Changer idea was mine, Shankar sir changed story: Retro director'Retro' director Karthik Subbaraj was credited for the story of Ram Charan and director Shankar' 'Game Changer'. In a recent interview, Karthik claimed that while he had given the one-liner, director Shankar changed the story and screenplay.

Actors Ajith Kumar, Shalini celebrate 25 years of togetherness in cute video. WatchActors Ajith Kumar and Shalini rang in their 25th wedding anniversary in a quiet celebration. Shalini shared a cute video in which they are feeding each other chocolate cake.

Billy Ray Cyrus confirms romance with Elizabeth Hurley after surprise textBilly Ray Cyrus confirms a new romance with Elizabeth Hurley, sparked by a heartfelt text. Reconnecting after two years, the pair's bond has brought him happiness and healing following a difficult divorce.

general news.headline: Expel Pakistanis, Amit Shah directs states after India moves to cancel visasFollowing a high-level meeting with top officials, Union Home Minister Amit Shah instructed Chief Ministers of all states to take immediate steps to deport them, a day after India cancelled all existing visas for Pakistani nationals.

Top LeT commander Altaf Lalli killed in gunfight in J&K's BandiporaOn Friday morning, acting on specific intelligence about the presence of terrorists, a joint search operation was launched by the Indian Army and Jammu and Kashmir Police in Bandipora. Contact was established with the terrorists, leading to a firefight.

Doing this dirty work for US: Pak minister admits to backing, training terroristsThe remark, a vindication of India's long-held stand, comes at a time when India has held Pakistan indirectly responsible for the terror attack in Pahalgam.

Top court scolds Rahul Gandhi over Savarkar remark: Your grandmother praised himThe Supreme Court on Thursday came down heavily on Congress leader Rahul Gandhi over his alleged objectionable remarks against freedom fighter Veer Savarkar, saying that the court won't allow such comments against freedom fighters and warning of suo motu action if repeated.

Here are eight kinetic options India can choose from to avenge PahalgamThe Pahalgam attack marked a turning point. With diplomatic heat rising and military options on the table, India is weighing its response to ensure Pakistan never repeats such a strike.

Pahalgam terrorist's house blown up using IEDs, another's bulldozedWhile the residence of Lashkar terrorist Adil Hussain Thoker was blown up using IEDs, the house of Asif Sheikh in Tral was demolished with a bulldozer.

Pakistani journalist asks US spokesperson question on J&K, gets shut downAsked if Trump was still willing to mediate over Kashmir like he had claimed during his first term in office, US State Department spokesperson, Tammy Bruce said during a press briefing, 'I'm not going to be remarking on it. I will say nothing more on that situation.'

He fell on my lap, I couldn't move in fear: J&K survivor recounts husband's deathOn Tuesday afternoon, five to six terrorists opened fire on a group of tourists in the Baisaran meadow, which is around 5 kms from Pahalgam. The meadow - also known as 'mini Switzerland' - is accessible only by foot or by horseback.

Arshad Nadeem competing in India out of question: Neeraj on row over inviteNeeraj Chopra issued a statement clarifying that the invitation to Arshad Nadeem for the NC Classic event was extended well before the  Pahalgam terror attack. Expressing deep pain, Neeraj said he and his family have been deeply hurt by the wave of hate and abuse they've faced since the controversy erupted.

Live: J&K Lt Governor holds security review meet with Army Chief, top security officialsPahalgam terror attack live updates: A crucial meeting on the Indus Water Treaty issue will be held today at the residence of Home Minister Amit Shah. Several Union Ministers, including Jal Shakti Minister CR Patil, are expected to attend the meeting. On Tuesday, 26 people were killed in a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam. Following the attack, India took a series of sweeping diplomatic and strategic countermeasures against Pakistan, including the effective downgrading of diplomatic relations with Pakistan, closure of key border routes, suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, and the expulsion of Pakistani military attaches from its High Commission in New Delhi. Follow indiatoday.in for more updates.

Pak opens fire along LoC, India retaliates amid tension over J&K attack: SourcesThree days after the Pahalgam terror attack, firing was reported from multiple Pakistani posts along the Line of Control (LoC) by the Pakistan Army throughout the night - an unusual development not reported in recent times, according to sources.

A snake on Mars: Curiosity rover's wheel tracks seen from spaceThe image marks the first time one of the Nasa's Mars orbiters has captured the rover driving on the Red Planet with wheel tracks visible from space.

Man asks Tesla to take him somewhere new, it drives to gym. Elon Musk reactsA video of a Tesla owner asking his car to take him somewhere new has gone viral on social media. The reason? It drove him to the gym. The hilarious clip now has Elon Musk's attention.

J&K attack: Pak Deputy PM calls Pahalgam terrorists 'freedom fighters'Terrorists had struck a prime tourist location at Baisaran meadows near Pahalgam in south Kashmir on Tuesday, killing 26 people, mostly tourists.

It was terror attack, simple: US House panel fact-checks NYT's Pahalgam headlineThe US House Foreign Affairs Committee slammed The New York Times for calling Pahalgam terrorists "militants", as top US leaders condemned the attack and reaffirmed strong support for India.

Why Pak army chief Asim Munir is desperate for a mini-war with IndiaIndia's top leadership, including PM Narendra Modi, has vowed a befitting reply over the Pahalgam massacre. Pakistan's role is undeniable, and India has both diplomatic and kinetic options on the table, like after the Uri and Pulwama attacks. This is why Pakistan's army chief, General Asim Munir, might be risking a limited war with India.

sports.headline: Virat Kohli took early retirement from T20Is, could have played till 2026: RainaFormer India cricketer Suresh Raina believes Virat Kohli retired from T20 Internationals too early. Raina said Kohli could have easily continued playing until the 2026 T20 World Cup.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP.
